publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4983 Sarah Boyack: Energy Saving Week - 23 to 29 October 2006—That the Parliament congratulates the Energy Saving Trust for organising its 10th annual Energy Saving Week from 23 to 29 October; urges all MSPs to make a pledge to adopt at least one of 10 small measures to reduce the amount of energy they consume on a daily basis: boiling only as much water as they need, turning down thermostats by 1°C, switching off appliances and not leaving them on standby, installing cavity wall insulation, topping up loft insulation to 270mm, replacing light bulbs with energy saving recommended ones, installing a condensing boiler, buying energy saving recommended appliances, washing laundry at 30°C and leaving cars at home for short journeys, and further notes that since the Energy Saving Trust was established it has made lifetime savings of around 20 million tonnes of carbon. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-4983 Energy Saving Week - 23 to 29 October 2006 (lodged on 23 October 2006) Trish Godman*, Marlyn Glen*, Derek Brownlee*, Maureen Macmillan*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Cathy Peattie*, Scott Barrie*, Mr John Swinney*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Dr Jean Turner*, Tommy Sheridan*, Karen Gillon*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mike Pringle*, Nora Radcliffe*, Des McNulty*, Bruce Crawford*, Patrick Harvie*, Bill Butler*, Christine May*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*
